answers.author: Jeff Rush
answers.text:
Pamela,
The City of Mesa is using Azteca Cityworks as our maintenance management platform, with several departments like Transportation, Energy & Water Resources, along with Facilities utilizing the system.  It's tightly integrated with our GIS (ESRI) environment, and currently serving several hundred users.  I'd be happy to field additional questions offline.
Jeff Rush
Manager - Enterprise GIS/CMMS
City of Mesa
480-644-3642
jeff.rush@mesaaz.gov

answers.author: Terri Birth
answers.text:
Pamela, the City of Durham also uses Cityworks for our infrastructure maintenance management.  If you're looking for a fleet maintenance solution, we are currently using FASTER  Asset Solutions - Fleet Management Software.
Terri Birth, GISP
GIS Analyst II
Department of Public Works, City of Durham
101 City Hall Plaza
Durham, NC  27701
(919)560-4326, x30274
www.DurhamNC.gov

answers.author: Tom Nosack
answers.text:
We have recently decided to upgrade our fleet system to Hansen 8. We have been using the Hansen system (V 7) with success and with a it allows us to integrate fleet, most public works, permitting (replacing Tidemark) warehouse management and utilties billing. Version 7 is powerful, flexible and integrates well with Oracle Financials. V8 provides the additional tools we needed.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
The City of Sunnyvale, CA is interested in learning what other agencies are using for Maintenance Management Software/Systems. They’d like to automate and have a single point of reference for all equipment, parts, vehicles, tools, etc.
If you have a similar system, please share what software you’re using and your satisfaction level.  And, a contact name, email and phone number to reach out to –
Thank you!
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Voice
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: Maintenance Management Software/System(s)
